section.class: s_cover parallax bg-black-50 s_parallax_no_overflow_hidden o_colored_level pt72 pb72

div.p: Get a custom quote for your 3D printed enclosure.

Explore Mech Power's cutting-edge 3D printing services, where innovation meets electronics enclosure design. With expertise in Fused Deposition Modeling (FDM) and Projection Printing(Figure 4), choose from an array of materials, each crafted with unwavering precision and specialized expertise.

Explore the groundbreaking Fused Deposition Modeling (FDM) technology – a game-changer in cost-effective prototype manufacturing. With precise layer-by-layer deposition, FDM empowers you to create intricate designs and functional prototypes with unmatched efficiency.
* Select from a wide range of materials with different strengths and properties tailored to your needs.
* Craft prototypes efficiently without overspending, thanks to FDM's optimized process.
* From functional prototypes to custom enclosures, FDM's precision suits various projects.

Embark on a journey into the realm of Projection 3D printing(Figure 4), where the interplay of light meticulously shapes intricate designs, layer by layer. This cutting-edge process lays the foundation for pioneering innovation, redefining the boundaries of what's possible.
* Projection printing ensures incredibly accurate and detailed designs.
* Get quick prototypes and low-volume production, speeding up your project.
* Create intricate designs effortlessly, even the most detailed shapes.
Powerviz is a nextgen tool where you can check your actual file. we can extended this line for more discription.
Explore our array of surface finish options to add both beauty and durability to your sheet metal creations.
Dry sanding smooths surfaces using abrasives without water or lubricants.
Wet sanding smooths surfaces using abrasive materials and water to reduce dust and heat.
Customization offerings allow products to be tailored to specific customer preferences or requirements, enhancing personalization and functionality.

div.h2: Unsure about the right 3D printing method?
div.p: Here's a comparison guide to help you choose the right 3D printing technology.

div.div: Light source cures layers of light-reactive resin
Wide range available, including PLA, ABS, etc.
Resins, such as PRO-BLK 10, Rigid White, Tough 60C White, etc.
Moderate speed depending on object complexity
Rapid printing for quick prototypes and low-volume production
Fine resolution with layers as thin as 20 to 50 microns
Smooth surface finish with high sidewall quality
Ideal for intricate and complex geometries
Solid and sturdy, suitable for functional parts
Strong mechanical properties and high precision
Offers a variety of specialized resins for diverse projects
Limited color options, often white, black, and clear
Prototyping, end-use parts, automotive, aerospace, etc.
Post-processing may involve curing and solvent cleaning
Moderate to fast depending on complexity
Fast turnaround, can achieve same-day production

div.p: Get a custom quote for your 3D printed enclosure.

Fused Deposition Modeling (FDM), also known as Fused Filament Fabrication, is an advanced 3D printing technique. It produces prototypes by precisely melting and depositing material layer by layer, resulting in intricate three-dimensional structures.

ul.li: Maximum Build Volume (WxDxH): 330 x 240 x 240 mm
Minimum Recommended Wall Thickness: Ensure structural integrity with a recommended minimum wall thickness of 1.2 mm, guaranteeing robustness without compromising on design intricacy.
Dimensional Accuracy: ±0.5%, coupled with a minimum deviation of ±0.5 mm.
Layer Height: Ranging from 50 to 200 microns

div.p: Get a custom quote for your projection printed enclosure.

Projection 3D printing, a cutting-edge additive manufacturing method, immerses you in the realm of precision engineering. Here, light meticulously crafts intricate designs, layer by layer, setting the stage for groundbreaking innovation. This technology, known for its remarkable precision and rapid prototyping capabilities, is driving transformative advancements across industries.

ul.li:
Maximum Build Volume (WxDxH):
330 x 240 x 240 mm
Minimum Recommended Wall Thickness: Guaranteeing structural integrity, we recommend a minimum wall thickness of 1 mm, offering resilience without compromise.
Dimensional Accuracy: ±0.25%, coupled with a minimum deviation of ±0.25 mm.
Layer Height: Ranging from 20 to 50 microns

div.div: Rapid transition from CAD to manufacturing line in a day. High throughput with smooth surfaces and mechanical properties.
Enduring environmental stability, clean white color. Suitable for medical, consumer, and industrial applications.
Medical devices, consumer goods, industrial components.
Lasting color, biocompatibility, smooth surface finish.
Biocompatible, impact-resistant, and maintains white color. Ideal for high mechanical load-bearing medical parts.
Injection molding-like surface finish, high-contrast gray. Well-suited for intricate detailing and painting.
Consumer products, precision components with textures.
High feature definition, suitable for painting.
Specially formulated for rubber parts' performance and properties. Ideal for applications requiring rubber-like traits.
Flame-retardant black material with high-temperature stability. Recommended for aerospace, transportation.
UL94 VO rating, high-temp stability, flame resistance.
Combines mechanical stability and light transmission. Achieves full transparency through post-processing.
High light transmission, transparent after processing.
Versatile production-grade black material with exceptional strength. Suitable for mechanical load-bearing parts.
